143769983.review:
As a Hololive fan, I think this game is a very cool project that Cover has come up with, and I love everything they release leading up to this game (video, interview, original soundtrack, etc.).

But as a person who likes games and horror-themed stuff in general (I don't play horror games often, though, as those are quite boring for me, the exception being Silent Hill and something similar), I think this game has a lot of good concepts, but the game feels a bit bland. What I'm talking about here is mostly the gameplay and the scariness of the game. The game itself is not that scary; to be honest, the game pace feels way too slow for me to feel anything was happening. The gameplay is mostly the same as any other modern horror (walking simulators, roller coasters), but due to the problem I mentioned before about the game's pace, the gameplay feels even more bland. Other games in the modern horror genre often have a puzzle to keep your brain active, but this game, from what I remember from my last session of playing, didn't have any puzzle at all, which didn't help with the slow pace of the game. However, I do like the lore that is being presented here; it is quite interesting.
But despite this criticism, I really do think the team who worked on it has the potential to make a great game in the future, as this is a great first project. So I wish for the best for the developer to continue working on their next project, whether it is Hololive-related or not. and I also would like them to try another horror project in the future, as I personally will be looking forward to it.

I will mark this review as recommend, but my stance is more like a mixed review.

If you're going to buy it, do it to support Cover, not for the game itself. Or just support the talents themselves directly.

137692108.review:
TLDR; Horror house simulator with Hololive crew

Hololive fans has to play it. It's mandatory. You'd never get Sora to be that creepy, nor get Korone angry enough to push you down. So far you can only get that from this game.

It's a horror house filled with creepy stuff. You cannot run. There are multiple jumpscares you know are coming. The game demonstrate how NOT to close your door in a hotel. The player seems to never engage the lock, which in a horror game annoys me to no end.

As I play the game, it does not scare me, but it does creep me out a few times. I think this game is basically a visual novel you walk into. It is a good game to play as you eat something because you can just walk straight for most of the game. Nothing threaten your life, so you can enjoy the food and listen to creepy sounds. Any real fear you have will be dispelled when you see the ghostly silhouette but you remember them all by their first name, so even if you're not good with horror, you will manage this one easily.

136238785.review: I mean its good tho, like for a horror game its enough give me chills. But theres not much content i guess.

135341183.review: Hey, you there! Ever wondered what P.T. would be like with a bunch of Vtubers in it? That's pretty much what you get when you play Hololive ERROR. It takes the same basic approach as P.T. with its looping hallways to traverse and secrets to discover; however it lacks some of the polish that came with the former Silent Hill demo. The first-person viewmodel arms could've been rigged better and the story could use some more streamlining. At times the game felt like it was trying to tell two different stories with only a little overlap. On the plus side; the graphics are quite nice, the atmosphere manages to remain creepy, and all the little Vtuber references and easter eggs would make any Hololive fan happy. All in all, I'd recommend giving this a go; however I'd wait for the sales, since $10 is a little steep for what you get.Just check this game out! I promise I'm not a simp.

132887890.review:
I will admit, as of the writing of this review I'm not the most knowledgeable guy when it comes to Hololive. So there may well be references in this game that flew over my head. However, I played it because I enjoy a good horror game, and I definitely recommend it. I'll give a link to my playthrough on Youtube below for anyone who wants to see a sample of gameplay, but to give some thoughts...

The visuals are smooth and work well for the general tone of the game. The sound design is fine, and the game did have an atmosphere that kept me engaged. Overall it was only a short experience (you can probably reach your first ending in around 1 hour or so), but that's fine by me - sometimes it's better for a game to keep things short and snappy rather than overstay its welcome. Speaking of endings, there are three of them in total, though you may need to consult guides in order to work out what steps are needed to find them.

As for the story, it isn't served to you on a plate; there are different threads that the player is left (to an extent) to weave together. Pretty standard fare in many horror games, I'd say - so nothing wrong with it. Where the Hololive aspect comes in is that the characters in the game are played by Hololive Vtubers. As far as I can tell, despite my earlier point about there potentially being references that might have gone right over my head, I don't think it matters whether you're a big Hololive fan or not - you can still follow the game's story regardless.

Not much else for me to say other than I definitely recommend it!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q2pdNLbJH1w&list=PL05Yc3_TEBpMtkJvTVG53YypsSDa9Yh8p

129450481.review:
I personally wouldn't really recommend this at all for anyone that isnt a hololive fan, and even for hololive fans, this game is not worth its full price (imo) and you should wait for a sale if you really wanna try it.

Story is incredibly empty if you haven't watched the web series and know the context of "hololive ERROR" as a whole, tho it's not like the game adds anything important to the overall story, infact it changes some bits, even some i would consider important.

The game may only scare you on your first 10-20 minutes because of the ambience, which at first is really well done but gets boring fast. It's also a very short game, taking 1 hour to complete or around 3 if you take the completionist approach.
Also, the game is poorly optimized on some parts, getting noticeable FPS drops despite being a fairly simple game.

Sorry if it seems like im hating, I REALLY love hololive but this game just isn't that good, perhaps my expectations were too high, but it really dissappointed me.

TLDR: Get it on sale if you want to support COVER and have a pretty mediocre horror experience

125508602.review:
Short of it is: I can't praise it. Even if you're a fan of Holo there's not really many reason to play this, story is barebones and there aren't that many voiced lines. The 2D anime series on YT is miles better.

124664631.review:
I do recommend this game but only if you get it on a good sale or are both a true Hololive and Horror fan. This game is almost linear with 3 endings effected only by adjustments to how you progress, similarly to other Japanese horror games. The story hardly tells itself and exists alongside the original mini series from YouTube. It's not a re-telling of the series, but rather it's your player character getting swept up in the events of the mini-series by accident while investigating it. 

The inability to sprint makes the game a painfully slow journey and there are some moments of the game that lag and lower the FPS to below 10. This includes the cutscene of the true ending. Only a beefy super computer seems to be able to run it lag free. (My machine may not be top of the line anymore but it's still good enough to run most high end games at max settings at 60FPS.) The game didn't do well scaring me much but it did nail the creepy atmosphere, especially early into the game.

You might be wondering how I can still recommend this, even to a niche group, with the problems I've listed. The reason for that is simply the fact that the game accomplishes what it sets out to do. It gives you a relatively enjoyable experience with Some of the Hololive talents you love, mostly Sora, that exists along side the popular horror mini-series they produced on YouTube. While I wish they had executed it better, it is my hope that some relative success for this game, along side some constructive feedback, will allow them to make an even better experience in the future.

124457889.review: The game is okay, good atmosphere but the story relies on knowledge of the hololiveERROR web series to understand what's going on. The game has a very strong start similar to other popular horror games in the such as PT but, it just becomes a walking simulator for the entire game. Main menu soundtrack is really good in my opinion. If anyone who is fan of Hololive but has not watched the web series, I highly recommend watching it before playing this game just to have some background knowledge of the games story line..

124238243.review:
I am a big Hololive fan, but I cannot recommend this game to anyone but the biggest Hololive fans. Was I scared playing through the game the first time? Yes, but I'm also a wimp so that doesn't say much. It was mostly an atmosphere thing in the beginning, along with a few good jumpscares. There wasn't much tension building for the rest of the game.

The game is locked to 60 fps, but even on a 3080 it would start dropping down into the 40s and even as low as 15 fps when there were more than one character model on screen.

The artstyle is confusing. It seems to go for a 3d anime style, but doesn't seem to be able to decide whether it should be stylized or not. There are also a lot of cases where models are clipping through each other, low resolution textures or shadows, etc.

The gameplay is very basic. It's a walking simulator with a few collectibles. Emphasis on few. No puzzles or anything other than walking forward is needed to progress. 

The story is confusing with no resolution. At almost no point do you get any sort of explanation of who anyone is or what they are doing there. The setting also doesn't make a ton of sense, as it's supposed to be a ghost town but has a multi-floored high school and a hotel?

There are multiple endings, but none of them explain what is happening in the game. When you get to the end, the title screen updates with a link to their animated series of Hololive Error. That series has an actual story, although it seems almost loosely based on the game rather than a companion piece.

If playing a game and seeing your Oshi on screen makes you happy, go ahead and buy it. If not, probably best to give this one a pass.

124130229.review:
Overall, a good game. Not really scary, but definitely a creepy atmosphere.

Pros:
- Creepy atmosphere with fun visual effects (reminds me a bit of F.E.A.R.)
- Interesting notes and collectibles
- Great OST
- Great character design
- Interesting story (albeit not well-explained)

Cons:
- The story could have been explained more for someone not familiar with Hololive
- Frame drops in a couple of early scenes
- Short game (~1 hour for one of the three endings)
- Could have used a couple of more jump scares to take advantage of the tense atmosphere

123537648.review:
As a Hololive simp, I’ll be giving my honest review about Hololive ERROR.

Pros

- Interesting storyline. (See the prequel videos at Hololive YouTube Official Channel and the manga for further understanding)
- Great arts and style for all the Holopro that involved here.
- Great OST.
- Great acting from all the Holopro that involved here as well. (Although some of them are funny)
- A combination between Chillia’s Art game (Although it’s inspired), Silent Hill, and Fatal Frame.
- Jumpscare is alright.

Cons

- Bugs and glitches occurred sometimes.
- Ragdolls are being weird.
- Lighting on the flashlight doesn't seem accurate and not bright.

Note: Even though there's already some patches, there's still a lot of things that need to be fixed.

Conclusion

Overall the game is great but it would be nice if they polished it more for better experience. Regardless, I really like it and I would recommend it for those who like Japanese school genre, horror stories, and especially Hololive simp.

My final score for this game is 8/10. My feedback for future Hololive games such as HoloEarth is that I hope the gameplay will be cleaner for a better experience. The concept is already a check mark for me but I hope there will be an improvement in the future because I'm looking forward to playing it.

123115107.review:
[h1] Disclaimer:[/h1]
 I really love Hololive but that doesn`t make me any[b] biased [/b] for making this review, i´ll be as[b] objective [/b] as i can be and point out the flaws of this game as it current version (2.1)

Is worth pointing out that this game assumes that you have watched the[url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL1NeGg1woXqmjylfq2x5E8dA2TUvQcK26] Web series [/url] previously. I heavily suggest that you watch it before jumping into the game so you´ll understand more of context of everything.

So, would i recomend the game if you haven`t seem the web series or are not a fan of Hololive?. Not at all

The reason i can´t fully recomend it:
[list]
    [*]The main issue is the game optimization, certain parts suffers a lot of FPS drops and becomes nearly unplayable
    [*]Lack of any music track playing for the entire game (despite there is a full album made for the web series), only background noise
    [*] The game is not that scary, maybe is the lack of jumpscares or the fact that the model of the girls looks perfectly normal and not horror themed.
    [*] Player speed is way too slow, can`t run either
    [*] Too short, took me around 1 hour to complete it
    [*] There are several endings, but the game never hints you at what to do to get other endings (since there is no dialogue/decisions options this becomes unclear to the player)
[/list]

Honestly, i´ll go for it only to support the company and potentially bring a more polished sequel. But i would wait for a sale at least before buying it.

122841381.review:
The game is based off the anime series you can find on the official Hololive Youtube channel. 

It is a pretty generic walking sim horror game with tons of, of course, Japanese style horror elements. The entire atmosphere is overall pretty creepy and the sounds and music play a pretty decent roll in the atmosphere as well. Wear headphones when you play as well since there are a lot spatial sounds to immerse your experience. 

The game is semi short with my first ending coming in at around 45min. The game could use some optimization, mostly in the graphics and some UI options as well as character animations. Be sure to select your language on the main menu, this only affects the text.

I'm not really a fan of horror games, but it is from Hololive, so I gave it a go. I personally think it is a decent game overall, obviously not the best on the market, but it plays well and lands the horror aspect. There isn't any jump scares as everything is all mostly suspense and build up with a chilling payoff. 

The talents also voice their respective characters and clicking on their names in the credits will take you to their specific Youtube channels.

My view is pretty biased though considering it is Hololive. So I'll ultimately support the project.

122838008.review:
Even with the game being as cheap as it is, I can't really recommend it to anyone. It's a walking simulator with nothing engaging to it,

The gameplay is dull and just pressing W. The story is... an attempt of one. The scenarios are heavily repeated. The character models don't have facial expressions, so when they look at you they just feel funny and out of place. It's also really badly optimized, my PC had bigger problems running this than it had running Doom Eternal. It's called Hololive Error, yet the story doesn't have anything to do with Hololive.

It's just a cash grab. A cheap one, at least.

122373298.review:
Just for a heads up, if you're planning on playing this game for a run, this game is going to be super short. You can probably play through it within an hour. And there's a lot of walking, not really much happened if ya don't try to get all of the endings which wouldn't be bad if there's some sort of achievements in the game. 

Also, I think the game is too little at utilizing the Hololive aspect in this Hololive horror game. In my playthough, there's like 3 occuring ones that are visible, while the rest of the characters are all black shadows. It's a bit sad when you're expecting that you could meet your oshi, when in reality you're going to see Sora more often and some girls that aren't even Hololive-related.

Is it a scary game? Not necessarily. I did jumped once, but other than that not much happened. And again, alot of walking.

Overall, 100/10 one of the horror games ever made

122365582.review:
I know very little about hololive outside of a few vTubers, and even less about the Hololive extended universe, but I paid $10 for this game upon release and I get the feeling I'll get at least 10 hours of playtime out of it. You don't have to know anything about hololiveERROR to enjoy the game, and I feel like it takes inspiration from very good sources, then implements those ideas well without being like...... borderline IP infringement. 

I'll be up front, I don't usually play this style of game, but I'm having a great time. Solid atmosphere, some intrigue, a dash of horror, some loud noises but the game doesn't rely too heavily on jump scares imo. A nice experience.

122349863.review:
It has a strong start, pulling a P.T. type hallway, but then you quickly realise that's the entire game.

The story is your typical Japanese rural horror story, just with all the character models replaced with Hololive characters. They could have done something cool with the whole VTuber thing, but instead it just feels like they added them in for marketing and nothing else.

Not much gameplay either. You hold W to move forward, you push E on doors and notes, and anything actually engaging happens in cutscenes.

Not a bad horror experience, just a very standard one with random anime girls thrown in.

122340995.review:
Hololive fans are going to buy it anyway, and they'll love it besides the walking speed which need to be increased especially on subsequent playthroughs. 

For those that arent hololive fans, you are getting a budget horror game which can be quite atmospheric at times especially when you're a using a headset. It sometimes screws up setting up a good scare, but overal it will spook you and unnerve you across its 1,5-3 hour run time. When you take the price and competition in this price class in consideration then it's a solid 7/10 for non Hololive fans and it's worth checking out if you're looking for a game for Halloween.

122339074.review:
This is a pretty short and linear experience, took me about 90 minutes to play through once, but I honestly dont regret buying it. 
Visuals are serviceable, sound and atmosphere are great too, I like the designs of the places you play in and the controls are simple. Honestly at this price point cant say much bad about the game, I think I got my money's worth. 
But, I'm a big Hololive fan, so that might influence my opinion of worth, someone not into hololive might see this offer very little content for that money.

122322539.review: It's good and it's hololive. And also, Glasses are really versatile. First, you can have glasses-wearing girls take them off and suddenly become beautiful, or have girls wearing glasses flashing those cute grins, or have girls stealing the protagonist's glasses and putting them on like, "Haha, got your glasses!" That's just way too cute! Also, boys with glasses! I really like when their glasses have that suspicious looking gleam, and it's amazing how it can look really cool or just be a joke. I really like how it can fulfill all those abstract needs. Being able to switch up the styles and colors of glasses based on your mood is a lot of fun too! It's actually so much fun! You have those half rim glasses, or the thick frame glasses, everything! It's like you're enjoying all these kinds of glasses at a buffet. I really want Luna to try some on or Marine to try some on to replace her eyepatch. We really need glasses to become a thing in hololive and start selling them for HoloComi. Don't. You. Think. We. Really. Need. To. Officially. Give. Everyone. Glasses?

122313043.review: If you're a fan of Hololive, this is a pretty safe buy. I don't know if they're planning on adding further content to this game, but if not, I would say the price is probably more like $5 worthy than $10. This is only a 3 hour experience, and thats if [spoiler] you go after the other endings [/spoiler]. The animations and art are relatively nice. I came across a bug where I fell through the floor at one point, and had to restart, but it's not that big of a setback thanks to the chapter select. Even though I play on a high-end PC, the levels, [spoiler] the shrine in particular [/spoiler] lag pretty badly for about 10 to 20 seconds at the beginning of the level. That's nitpicky though, overall this is a fun experience for Hololive fans and I recommend it. If you aren't a Hololive fan and was just interested in the horror aspect, you can probably skip this.
